intro: Hieracium friwaldii, commonly known as the Friwald's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Central Europe and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and tubular florets, typical of the dandelion family. Hieracium friwaldii is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with well-drained soil.
